text: This is a list of video games markets by country: As of 2018, video games generated sales of US$134.9 billion annually worldwide. In 2019, the mobile games revenue reached $61.7 billion and the online games $16.9 billion. In 2018, the global console games market was valued at about $26.8 billion and the PC games market was valued at about $27.7 billion. Another estimate puts $109.8 billion in total revenue generated by digital games in 2018 (this number doesn't include consoles), with mobile accounted for $61.3 billion, PC games with $35.7 billion and consoles with $12.7 billion. {| class="wikitable sortable" !Country !Market !Employees !Gamers |- |United States |$27.9 billion |220,000 |150 million |- |China |$37.9 billion |330,000 in Esports |660 million |- |Japan |$11.5 billion | |67.6 million |- |United Kingdom |£5.7 billion |20,000 |32.4 million |- |Germany |€4.4 billion | |44.3 million |- |Canada |$3 billion |20,400 |19 million |- |France |€2.7 billion |5,000 |32.6 million |- |Australia |$2.9 billion |928 | |- |Russia |$2 billion | |65.2 million |- |Italy |€1.8 billion | |26.2 million |- |Spain |€1.5 billion | |16.8 million |- |Finland |€1.8 billion |2,500 | |- |Sweden |€1.8 billion |8,000 |4.2 million |- |India |$0.8 billion | |300 million |} ==References== == External links == * https://newzoo.com/insights/rankings/top-10-countries- by-game-revenues/
